safety.cause: Cutting through the supply hose or immersing the Aqua-Stop valve in water is dangerous.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Never immerse the plastic housing in water. The plastic housing on the supply hose contains an electric valve.
Never cut through the supply hose. The supply hose contains electric power cables.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Failure to comply with safety instructions and directions for use on packagings of detergent and rinse aid products may cause serious harm to health.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Follow the safety instructions and directions for use on the packagings of detergent and rinse aid products.

safety.creator: Kreutz, Christa
safety.cause: Adding solvents to the interior of the appliance may cause explosions.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Never add solvents to the interior of the appliance.

safety.creator: Kreutz, Christa
safety.cause: Highly caustic alkaline or highly acidic cleaning agents in conjunction with aluminium parts in the interior of the appliance may cause explosions.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Never use highly caustic alkaline or highly acidic cleaning agents, in particular commercial or industrial products, in conjunction with aluminium parts (e.g. grease filters of extractor hoods or aluminium pans), e.g. for the Machine Care programme.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian (Taxonomy admin)
safety.title: safety_Risk of injury_Open door_en
safety.cause: Leaving the appliance door open may result in injury.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Only open the appliance door to load or unload tableware in order to prevent accidents, e.g. through tripping.
Do not sit or stand on the appliance door when open.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Knives and utensils with sharp points can cause injuries.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Arrange knives and utensils with sharp points in the cutlery basket with the points downwards, on the knife shelf or in the cutlery drawer.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: If you open the appliance door while the programme is running, hot water may splash out of the appliance.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Open the appliance door carefully if the programme is still running.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Overfilling the Baskets may cause the appliance to tip up.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Never overfill the Baskets with free-standing appliances.

node.creator: Lu, Tingting
node.title: Safe installation
node.p: Follow the instructions when installing the appliance.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Improper installation of the appliance may cause damage.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: If the dishwasher is installed above or below other domestic appliances, follow the information on installation in combination with a dishwasher in the installation instructions for the individual appliances.

If there is no information or if the installation instructions do not include the relevant information, contact the manufacturer of these appliances to check that the dishwasher can be installed above or below these appliances.
If no information is available from the manufacturer, the dishwasher should not be installed above or below such appliances.
To ensure the safe operation of all domestic appliances, continue following the installation instructions for the dishwasher.
UM - entire product lifecyclePDC_UM - component identityPDC - function identityDo not install the dishwasher under a hob.
Do not install the dishwasher near heat sources, e.g. radiators, heat storage tanks, ovens or other appliances that generate heat.

node.title: Safe use
node.p: Follow the instructions when using the appliance.

safety.creator: Kaden-ext, Babett
safety.cause: Escaping water vapour can damage fitted units.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: When the programme ends, leave the appliance to cool down for a while before opening the door.

safety.creator: Schmid, Bianca
safety.cause: Special salt for dishwashers can damage the tub due to corrosion.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: To make sure that any special salt that escapes is washed out of the tub, add the special salt to the dispenser for special salt immediately before the programme starts.

safety.creator: Schmid, Bianca
safety.cause: Detergent may damage the water softening system.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Only fill the dispenser of the water softening system with special dishwasher salt.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Unsuitable cleaning agents may damage the appliance.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Do not use a steam cleaner.
So as not to scratch the finish on the appliance, do not use sponges with a rough surface or abrasive cleaning agents.
To prevent corrosion, do not use sponge cloths on dishwashers with a stainless steel front or rinse such cloths thoroughly several times before using them for the first time.

proptype.p: Zeolith drying automatically helps to save energy.

node.creator: admRadke, Sebastian
node.title: Zeolith drying
node.p: The appliance features a Zeolith container. Zeolith drying lets you save energy.
Zeolite is a mineral that can store moisture and heat energy and then release them again.
During dishwashing heat energy is used to heat up the washing water and dry the mineral.

During the drying phase moisture from the interior of the dishwasher is stored in the mineral and heat energy is released. The heat energy is blown out into the interior of the dishwasher with dry air. This speeds up and improves drying.
Zeolith drying therefore saves a great deal of energy.

hint.p: To avoid impairing Zeolith drying performance, do not position tableware parts directly in front of the intake opening or the blow opening of the Zeolith container.
Do not position heat-sensitive tableware parts directly in front of the blow opening of the Zeolith container. "Appliance",

node.creator: admRadke, Sebastian
node.title: AquaSensor
node.p: The AquaSensor is an optical measuring device (light barrier) which measures the turbidity of the rinsing water. You can save water with the AquaSensor.

Use of the AquaSensor depends on the programme. If the soiling level is high, the rinsing water is drained off and replaced with fresh water. If the soiling level is lower, the rinsing water is used in the next wash cycle, so reducing water consumption by 3-6 litres. In the automatic programmes the temperature and run time are additionally adjusted to the level of soiling.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Sensors
node.p: The sensors adjust the programme sequence and strength in the automatic programmes depending on the level and type of soiling.
The sensor has different sensitivity settings that can be changed in the basic settings. "Changing basic settings",

propvalue.p: Optimum setting for a mixed load and heavily soiled tableware. Saves both energy and water.
Adjusts the programme strength for effective removal of food remnants even with low soiling levels. Energy and water consumption are adjusted accordingly.

Adjusts the programme strength for difficult conditions of use, e.g. stubborn dried-on food remnants. Recommended setting when using organic or ecological detergents containing low levels of active agents. Energy and water consumption are adjusted accordingly.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca

variable.variableName: Baisc Settings - Türöffnung in allen Programmen

node.p: The appliance door opens automatically during the drying phase. This ensures a particularly economical drying result.

savingdrying assistantA3 (MH); P5 (TW)PDC_UM - component identityPDC - function identityFor best drying results wait until the end of programme before unloading the tableware. The programme has ended when the display shows Finished.
If the automatic door opening is deactivated, energy consumption increases and the drying phase is usually reduced.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Installing and connecting the appliance
node.p: preparing and installationPDC_UM - component identityPDC - function identityYou can position your built-under or integrable appliance in a fitted kitchen between wooden and plastic walls. If you subsequently install your dishwasher as a free-standing appliance, you must stop it from tipping over, e.g. by screwing it to the wall or installing it under a continuous worktop that is securely connected to adjacent cabinets.

instruction.p: Check the Scope of supply and the condition of the appliance.
Consult the installation instructions for the installation dimensions required.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Make the appliance level using the height-adjustable feet.

instruction-info.p: Make sure that the appliance is standing on the floor securely.

instruction.p: Connect the appliance to the power supply.

node.creator: admRadke, Sebastian
node.title: Drainage connection
node.p: Connect your appliance to drainage connection so dirty water is discharged via the wash cycle.

instruction.p: Consult the installation instructions supplied for the steps required here.
Connect the wastewater hose to the outlet connection of the siphon using the enclosed parts.
When doing so, check that the wastewater hose is not kinked, crushed or twisted.
Also check that there is no cover in the drainage system preventing the wastewater from being discharged.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Drinking water connection
node.p: Connect your appliance to a drinking water connection.

sub-hint.p: If you are replacing the appliance, you must use a new water supply hose.

instruction.p: Consult the installation instructions supplied for the steps required here.
Connect the appliance to the drinking water connection using the enclosed parts.

instruction-info.p: Observe the "Technical data".

instruction.p: When doing so, check that the drinking water connection is not kinked, crushed or twisted.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Electrical connection
node.p: Connect your appliance to the power supply.

link.target: Connecting the appliance to the electricity supply
link.name: InformationHierarchy

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Connecting the appliance to the electricity supply

sub-hint.p: Please follow the "Safety instructions".
Connect the appliance to alternating current only, in the range of 220 - 240 V and 50 Hz or 60 Hz.
Please note that the water safety system is only functional if there is a power supply.

instruction.p: Insert the non-heating appliance plug of the power cable into the appliance.
Insert the mains plug of the appliance into a nearby socket.

instruction-info.p: The connection data for the appliance can be found on the rating plate.

instruction.p: Check that the mains plug is inserted properly.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Programmes
node.p: You can find an overview of the programmes that can be selected here. Different programmes, which can be found on the control panel of your appliance, are available depending on the appliance configuration.

The running time may vary depending on the programme selected. The running time depends on the water temperature, the quantity of tableware, the level of soiling and the additional function selected. The running time will change if the rinse aid system is switched off or rinse aid needs to be added.

The consumption values can be found in the quick reference guide. The consumption values relate to normal conditions and a water hardness of 16 - 20 °E. Different influencing factors such as water temperature or pipe pressure may result in deviations.

li.p: Washing pots and pans, non-fragile tableware and cutlery.
Removing stubborn burned or dried-on food remnants containing starch and protein.

hint.p: The relatively long running time in the Eco 50 ° programme is due to longer soaking and drying times. This results in optimal consumption values.

node.p: Test institutes are provided with information for comparability tests, e.g. according to EN60436.
These are the conditions for conducting the tests, however they are not the results or consumption values.
E-mail enquiries to: dishwasher@test-appliances.com
The product number (E-Nr.) and the production number (FD) are required here. They can be found on the rating plate on the appliance door.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Additional functions
node.p: You can find an overview of the additional functions that can be selected here. Different additional functions, which can be found on the control panel of your appliance, are available depending on the appliance configuration.

metalist.meta: Thermador; Neff; Bosch; Gaggenau; Pitsos; Profilo; Balay; Constructa; Siemens

li.p: The run time is shortened by 15% to 75% depending on the rinse programme.
The additional function can be activated before the start of the programme and at any time when the programme is running.
Energy and water consumption are increased.

propvalue.p: drying assistantTurbo; VarioSpeedPlus; VarioSpeedTFT displayIf you select this additional function, "automatic door opening" in the On with Eco 50° setting is deactivated.

li.p: To ensure a higher hygiene status for the appliance and tableware, the temperature is raised and maintained for an extra-long period.
Especially suitable for cleaning chopping boards or baby bottles.
Continuous use of this function increases the hygiene status.
This will increase the run time and energy consumption.
Switch on with mixed loads containing tableware with different soiling levels, e.g. place very soiled pots and pans in the bottom basket and normally soiled tableware in the upper basket.
The spray pressure in the bottom basket is increased and the maximum programme temperature held longer. This will increase the run time and energy consumption.
For a better drying result the final rinse temperature is increased and the drying phase extended.
Especially suitable for drying plastic parts.
There is a slight increase in energy consumption and the run time is extended.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Pull out the top basket.
To prevent the basket from suddenly dropping down, hold the side of the basket by the top edge.
Press in the levers on the right and left on the outside of the basket.

instruction-info.p: The basket can then slip down slightly.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Raise or lower the basket evenly to the right level. "Basket heights",

instruction-info.p: Check that the basket is level on both sides.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Slide the basket back in.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Cutlery drawer
node.p: Arrange cutlery in the cutlery drawer.
Arrange cutlery with the points and sharp edges downwards.
product description2.0cutlery drawerPDC - function identityYou can reorganise the cutlery drawer to make more space for longer/wider items of cutlery.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Reorganising cutlery drawer
node.p: You can fold down the side shelves and front prongs to make more space for longer/wider items of cutlery.

instruction.p: To fold down a side shelf, push the lever forwards and fold down the side shelf .
To fold down the front prongs, push the lever forwards and fold down the prongs.

hint.p: If you want to return the cutlery drawer to the original position, fold the side shelf back up until it clicks into position.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Etagere
node.p: Use the cutlery shelf and space underneath for small cups and glasses or for large items of cutlery, e.g. cooking spoons or serving cutlery.
If you do not need the cutlery shelf, you can fold it up.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Folding prongs
node.p: Use the folding prongs to position tableware securely, e.g. plates.
You can fold the prongs down to position pans, bowls and glasses better."footnotes",

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Folding down prongs"footnotes",
node.p: If you do not need the prongs, fold them down.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Push the lever forwards and fold down the prongs .
To use the prongs again, fold them back up.

result.p: The prongs audibly click into position.

node.p: product descriptionnozzle barBoschBSHM_BMRK###A01basket equipmentPDC - function identityUse the Extra Clean Zone in the top basket to clean soiled tableware thoroughly, e.g. muesli bowls.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: product descriptionnozzle barBoschBSHM_BMRK###A01basket equipmentPDC - function identitySelecting Extra Clean Zone

hint.creator: Miller, Eva
hint.p: Consumption will increase if you operate your appliance with the Extra Clean Zone switched on.

instruction.p: Pull out the top basket.
Set the slider to ON or OFF.
Push in the top basket.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: product descriptionnozzle barBoschBSHM_BMRK###A01basket equipmentPDC - function identityCleaning Extra Clean Zone
node.p: Limescale and soiling from the dishwashing water can block the nozzles.

hint.creator: Miller, Eva
hint.p: Always operate the appliance with the Extra Clean Zone fitted.

instruction.p: Pull out the top basket.
product descriptionnozzle barBoschBSHM_BMRK###A01basket equipmentPDC - function identityPull the tab on the Extra Clean Zone up and forwards .
Set the slider to ON.
Clean under running water.
product descriptionnozzle barBoschBSHM_BMRK###A01basket equipmentPDC - function identityPlace the Extra Clean Zone in the top basket and lock in place .

instruction-info.p: Check that the mounts are in the correct position.

result.creator: Miller, Eva
result.p: The Extra Clean Zone audibly clicks into position .

instruction.p: Push in the top basket.

node.title: Performing initial start-up

metalist.meta: PDC - function identity; ALL - function identity

node.p: On initial start-up or after a reset to the factory settings, you will need to make settings.

hint.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
hint.p: Connect your appliance to a mobile device. You can conveniently change all settings via the Home Connect app. "Home Connect quick start",

precondition.link: "The appliance has been installed and connected."

instruction.p: Switch on the appliance.

result.p: The display shows the settings for initial start-up.

instruction.p: Press repeatedly until the display shows the required setting.

instruction-info.p: You can change the settings for initial start-up and other "Basic settings" on the appliance at any time or use the Home Connect app on your mobile device.

metalist.meta: Australia; USA; Ukraine; Turkey; Taiwan; Switzerland; South Korea; South Africa; Saudi Arabia; Russia; Middle East; Latin America; Japan; Israel; Iran; India; Hong Kong; Gulf Countries; Europe; East Asia; Central Asia; Asia Pacific; country-neutral

instruction.p: Start the Programme with the highest cleaning temperature without tableware.

instruction-info.p: To remove any marks from water or other residues, we recommend you operate the appliance without tableware before using it for the first time.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Water softening system
node.p: Hard water leaves limescale on the tableware as well as the washing tank and parts of the appliance may become blocked.
To ensure good dishwashing results, you can treat the water with special salt and the water softening system. To avoid damage to the appliance, water with a hardness above 9 °E must be softened.

link.target: Switching off the water softening system
link.name: InformationLink

link.target: Regeneration of the water softening system
link.name: InformationLink

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Overview of water hardness settings

metalist.meta: LED 7 segment display; 7 segment display; TFT display

node.p: You can find an overview of the water hardness values that can be selected here.
You can find out how hard your water is from your local water company or by using a water hardness tester.

hint.creator: Schmid, Bianca

metalist.meta: LED; LED 7 segment display; TFT display; 7 segment display

hint.p: Set the water hardness determined on your appliance. "Setting the water softening system",
With a water hardness of 0 - 8 °E you can dispense with special salt for dishwashers and switch off the water softening system. "Switching off the water softening system",

link.target: Switching off the water softening system
link.name: RelatedTopic

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Setting the water softening system
node.p: Set the water hardness on your appliance.

instruction.p: Determine the water hardness and the appropriate setting value. "Overview of water hardness settings",

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Press .

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: To open the basic settings, press for approx. 3 seconds.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Press repeatedly until the display shows Water hardness.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian

metalist.meta: A3 (MH); MW; P5 (TW); A5 (MW); A1 (MB); MB

instruction.p: Press or repeatedly until the right water hardness has been set.

instruction-info.p: The value 16 - 20 is set at the factory.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: To save the settings, press for approx. 3 seconds.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Special salt
node.p: You can use special salt to soften water.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Adding special salt
node.p: If the special salt refill indicator lights up, add special salt to the dispenser for special salt just before the programme starts. The amount of special salt required depends on the water hardness: the higher the water hardness, the greater the amount of special salt required.

safety.creator: Schmid, Bianca
safety.cause: Detergent may damage the water softening system.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Only fill the dispenser of the water softening system with special dishwasher salt.

safety.creator: Schmid, Bianca
safety.cause: Special salt for dishwashers can damage the tub due to corrosion.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: To make sure that any special salt that escapes is washed out of the tub, add the special salt to the dispenser for special salt immediately before the programme starts.

instruction.p: Unscrew the lid of the dispenser for special salt and remove.
On initial start-up: Fill the dispenser right up with water.

hint.p: Only use special salt for dishwashers.
Do not use salt tablets.
Do not use table salt.

instruction.p: Add the special salt to the dispenser.

instruction-info.p: Fill the dispenser right up with special salt. The water in the dispenser is displaced and forced out.

instruction.p: Place the lid back on the dispenser and turn to close.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Switching off the water softening system
node.p: If you find the special salt refill indicator irritating, e.g. when using combined detergents with salt replacement substances, you can switch the salt refill indicator off.

intro.p: To avoid damage to the appliance, only switch off the water softening system in the following cases:

li.p: The water hardness is max. 26 °E and you are using combined detergents with salt replacement substances. According to manufacturers, combined detergents with salt replacement substances can generally only be used up to a water hardness of 26 °E without adding special salt.
The water hardness is 0 - 8 °E. You do not need to use special salt.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Press .

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: To open the basic settings, press for approx. 3 seconds.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Press repeatedly until the display shows Water hardness.

instruction.creator: Miller, Eva

metalist.meta: A3 (MH); MW; P5 (TW); A5 (MW); A1 (MB); MB

instruction.p: Press or repeatedly until the display shows 0 - 8.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: To save the settings, press for approx. 3 seconds.

result.creator: Schmid, Bianca
result.p: The water softening system is switched off and the salt refill indicator is deactivated.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Regeneration of the water softening system
node.p: In order to obtain fault-free function of the water softening system, the appliance performs regeneration of the water softening system at regular intervals.
Regeneration of the water softening system takes place before the end of the main rinse cycle in all programmes. It will increase the run time and consumption values, e.g. water and electricity.

link.target: Overview of consumption values with regeneration the water softening system
link.name: InformationHierarchy
link.source: Regeneration of the water softening system

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Overview of consumption values with regeneration the water softening system
node.p: Here you can find an overview of the maximum additional run time and consumption values during regeneration of the water softening system.

proptype.p: Regeneration of the water softening system after x rinse cycles

node.p: The consumption values specified are laboratory measurements determined in accordance with the currently applicable standard and using the Eco 50° programme and the factory value of the water hardness is set to 16 - 20°E.

node.creator: Bendl, Klaus
node.title: Rinse aid system
node.p: You can use the rinse aid system and rinse aid to get tableware and glasses rinsed perfectly without marks.

link.target: Setting the amount of rinse aid
link.name: InformationLink

link.target: Switching the rinse aid system off

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Rinse aid
node.p: For optimum drying results, use rinse aid.
Only use rinse aid for domestic dishwashers.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Adding rinse aid
node.p: inputTFT displayrinse aid dispenserPDC - function identityIf the display shows Please add rinse aid. , add rinse aid. Only use rinse aid for domestic dishwashers.

instruction.p: Press the catch on the lid of the dispenser for rinse aid and lift .
Add rinse aid up to the max mark.
If rinse aid spills out, remove it from the tub.

instruction-info.p: Spilled rinse aid can cause excessive frothing during the wash cycle.

instruction.p: Close the lid of the dispenser for rinse aid.

result.p: The lid clicks into position.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Setting the amount of rinse aid
node.p: featurerinse aid dispenserPDC - function identityIf there are streaks or water marks on tableware, change the amount of rinse aid.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Press .

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: To open the basic settings, press for approx. 3 seconds.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Press repeatedly until the display shows Rinse aid dispenser.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian

metalist.meta: A3 (MH); MW; P5 (TW); A5 (MW); A1 (MB); MB

instruction.p: Press or repeatedly until the right amount of rinse aid has been set.

li.p: A low setting adds less rinse aid during the wash cycle and reduces streaking on tableware.
A higher setting adds more rinse aid during the wash cycle, reduces water marks and improves the drying result.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: To save the settings, press for approx. 3 seconds.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Detergent
node.p: Find out which detergents are suitable for your appliance.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Suitable detergents
node.p: Only use detergents that are suitable for dishwashers. Both separate and combined detergents are suitable.
For optimum washing and drying results, use separate detergent, adding "Special salt" and "Rinse aid" separately.

Modern, powerful detergents mainly use a low-alkaline formulation with enzymes. Enzymes break down starch and remove protein. Oxygen-based bleaching agents are generally used to remove coloured marks, e.g. tea or ketchup.

hint.p: Follow the manufacturer's instructions for each detergent.

propvalue.p: Tabs are suitable for all cleaning functions and do not need to be measured out.
With shorter "Programmes" tabs sometimes do not dissolve entirely and leave residues of detergent. This may impair the cleaning effect.
Powder detergent is recommended for shorter "Programmes".
The dosage can be adjusted to the level of soiling.
Liquid detergent works faster and is recommended for shorter "Programmes" without PreRinse.

intro.p: Sometimes liquid detergent may leak out despite the detergent dispenser being closed. This is not a fault and is non-critical if you remember the following:

li.p: Only choose a programme without PreRinse.
Do not select timer programming for starting the programme.

propvalue.p: The dosage can be adjusted to the level of soiling.

hint.creator: Schmid, Bianca

metalist.meta: Lynx; Küppersbusch; Novamatic; Cylinda; Sharp; Schulthess; V-Zug; Lord; Koenic; Blaupunkt; label brands; local hero brands; global brands

hint.p: Suitable detergents are available online via our website or from "Customer Service".

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Separate detergents
node.p: Separate detergents are products that do not contain components other than detergent, e.g. powder detergent or liquid detergent.
With powder and liquid detergent the dosage can be individually adjusted to the level of soiling of the tableware.
For better washing and drying results and to avoid damage to the appliance, please additionally use "Special salt" and "Rinse aid".

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Combined detergent
node.p: Besides conventional separate detergents, a number of products are available with additional functions. These products contain not only detergent but also rinse aid and salt replacement substances (3in1) and, depending on the combination (4in1, 5in1, ...), additional components such as glass protection or stainless steel cleaner.

According to manufacturers, combined detergents generally only function up to a water hardness of 26 °E. With a water hardness above 26 °E you will need to add special salt and rinse aid. For the best washing and drying results we recommend using special salt and rinse aid from a water hardness of 17 °E. If you are using combined detergent, the washing programme is adjusted automatically to ensure the best possible washing and drying result.

node.creator: Hirn-ext, Stefan
node.title: Unsuitable detergents
node.p: Do not use detergent which could cause damage to the appliance or present a risk to health.

propvalue.p: Hand washing-up liquid can cause increased frothing and damage the appliance.
Chlorine residue on tableware may present a risk to health.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Information on detergents
node.p: Follow the instructions on detergents in everyday use.

proptype.p: Detergents marked as "organic" or "ecological" (environmentally friendly) generally contain lower levels of active agents or completely dispense with certain substances. The cleaning effect may be restricted here.
Set the rinse aid and the water softening system to the separate detergent or combined detergent in use.

According to manufacturers, combined detergents with salt replacement substances can only be used up to a certain water hardness, usually 26 °E, without adding special salt. For the best washing and drying results we recommend using special salt from a water hardness of 17 °E.
To prevent sticking, only touch detergents in a water-soluble pouch with dry hands and only ever place them in a dry detergent dispenser.
Even if the rinse aid and special salt refill indicators light up, washing programmes will run properly with combined detergents.
The function of rinse aid is limited with combined detergents. You will generally get better results using rinse aid.
Use tablets with a special drying performance.

instruction.p: To open the detergent dispenser, press the locking latch.
Add the detergent to the dry detergent dispenser.

instruction-info.p: If you are using tablets, one is enough. Insert the tablets in a horizontal position.
If you are using powder or liquid detergent, follow the manufacturer's instructions and quantities for dosage in the detergent dispenser.

- function identity20 ml – 25 ml detergent is sufficient for normal soiling. If tableware is only lightly soiled, slightly less than the amount of detergent specified is usually sufficient.

instruction.p: Close the lid of the detergent dispenser.

result.p: The lid clicks into position.

result.creator: Schmid, Bianca
result.p: The detergent dispenser will open automatically at the optimum time during the programme. Powder or liquid detergent will spread around the washing tank and dissolve there. Tablets will fall into the tablet collecting tray and dissolve in the right dosage. In order to ensure that tablets can dissolve evenly, do not place any other objects in the tablet collecting tray.

hint.creator: Miller, Eva
hint.p: If you use powder detergent and select a program with pre-rinse, you can also add a little detergent to the interior door of the appliance.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Tableware
node.p: Only clean tableware that is suitable for dishwashers.

hint.p: Decorated glassware and parts made of aluminium or silver may fade or discolour with dishwashing. Delicate types of glass may turn cloudy after a few washing cycles.

node.creator: Hirn-ext, Stefan
node.title: Damage to glass and tableware
node.p: Avoid damage to glass and tableware.

intro.p: The following tableware is not dishwasher-safe:

li.p: Items of cutlery and tableware made from wood
Decorated glassware, antique and hand-crafted tableware
Plastic parts not resistant to heat
Tableware made from copper or tin
Tableware soiled with ash, wax, lubricating grease or paint
Very small items of tableware

propvalue.p: Only put tableware in the dishwasher if it is marked as dishwasher-safe by the manufacturer.

proptype.p: Glass and tableware was not dishwasher-safe.

propvalue.p: Only put glasses and china in the dishwasher if it is marked as dishwasher-safe by the manufacturer.

proptype.p: The chemical composition of the detergent causes damage.

propvalue.p: Use a detergent marked as gentle on tableware by the manufacturer.

proptype.p: Highly caustic alkaline or highly acidic cleaning agents, in particular commercial or industrial cleaning agents, are not suitable for dishwashers in conjunction with aluminium.

propvalue.p: If you are using highly caustic alkaline or highly acidic cleaning agents, in particular commercial or industrial cleaning agents, do not put aluminium parts in the dishwasher interior.

proptype.p: The water temperature of the programme is too high.

propvalue.p: Select a programme with lower temperatures.
After the programme has ended, take glassware and cutlery out of the appliance without delay.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Arrange tableware
node.p: Arrange tableware correctly to optimise the dishwashing result and prevent damage to both the appliance and tableware.

sub-hint.p: Using the appliance allows you to save energy and water compared to washing-up by hand.

metalist.meta: Lynx; Küppersbusch; Novamatic; Cylinda; Sharp; Schulthess; Lord; Koenic; Blaupunkt; label brands; local hero brands; global brands

sub-hint.p: See our website for examples of how to load your appliance efficiently, free of charge.
To save energy and water, load the machine with the number of place settings specified. "Technical specifications",
For better washing and drying results, position items with curves or recesses at an angle so water can run off.

instruction.p: Remove large remnants of food from your tableware.

instruction-info.p: To save resources, do not pre-rinse tableware under running water.

instruction.p: Observe the following when arranging tableware:

li.creator: Schmid, Bianca
li.p: Put heavily soiled tableware in the bottom basket, e.g. pans. The more powerful the spray jet, the better the dishwashing result will be.
To prevent damage to tableware, arrange it so it is stable and cannot tip over.
To prevent injury, arrange cutlery with the points and sharp edges facing down.
Position containers with the openings facing down so no water can collect in them.

li.creator: Schmid, Bianca
li.p: Do not block the spray arms - make sure that they can turn freely.

li.creator: Schmid, Bianca
li.p: Do not place small parts in the tablet collecting tray and do not block it with tableware so as not to obstruct the lid of the detergent dispenser.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Hot tableware can cause burns to the skin. When hot, tableware is sensitive to shock, may crack and can result in injury.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: When the programme has ended, do not empty the appliance until the tableware has cooled down for a while.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: To prevent water dripping on the tableware, unload it starting at the bottom and working up.
Check the washing tank and accessories for soiling and clean if necessary. "Cleaning and servicing",

node.p: You can delay the start of the programme by up to 24 hours.

Press or repeatedly until the display shows the right time.

instruction-info.p: Depending on the setting of the time display, the end of the programme is shown on the display either with Finish in (e.g. 3h 25min) or Finish at (e.g. 15:20 hours). You can change this setting in the "Basic settings".

result.creator: Schmid, Bianca
result.p: The programme has ended when the display shows Finished.

sub-hint.p: If you want to add more tableware while the appliance is running, do not use the tablet collecting tray as a handle for the top basket. You might touch the partially dissolved tablet.
You can only change a programme when running if you cancel it. "Terminate programme",

The appliance switches off automatically 1 minute after the end of the programme to save energy. If you open the appliance door immediately after the programme has ended, the appliance will switch off after 4 seconds.

hint.p: When you open the appliance door once the appliance has heated up, leave the door slightly ajar for a few minutes and then close it. This will help prevent excess pressure building up in the appliance and stop the appliance door bursting open.

instruction.p: Press .

result.p: The programme is saved and the appliance switches off.

instruction.p: Press to resume the programme.

Wi-Fi on the router is activated.
The appliance receives signals from the WLAN home network (Wi-Fi) at its installation location.

instruction.p: With the help of the Home Connect App scan the QR code.
Follow the instructions in the Home Connect app.

node.p: Adapt Home Connect to your needs.

You can find the Home Connect settings in the basic settings for your appliance. Which settings the display shows will depend on whether Home Connect has been set up and whether the appliance is connected to your home network.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.p: You can use the Home Connect app to start the appliance with your mobile device.

hint.creator: Schmid, Bianca
hint.p: If you select Permanent in the "Basic settings" of this function, the function is permanently activated and you can start your appliance with a mobile device at any time.

hint.p: For further information and details about the availability of Remote Diagnostics in your country, please visit the service/support section of your local website: www.home-connect.com

node.creator: Lu, Tingting
node.title: Software update
node.p: You can use this function to update the software of your appliance, e.g. for optimisation, troubleshooting or safety-relevant updating.
The Home Connect app informs you about available software updates.

node.creator: Schmid, Bianca
node.title: Data protection

metalist.meta: PRF_UM - component identity; PLC_UM - component identity; PDC_UM - component identity; PCP_UM - component identity beverage; PCG_UM - component identity

node.p: Please see the information on data protection.

intro.p: The first time your appliance is registered on a home network connected to the Internet, your appliance will transmit the following types of data to the Home Connect server (initial registration):

li.p: Unique appliance identification (consisting of appliance codes as well as the MAC address of the Wi-Fi communication module installed).
Security certificate of the Wi-Fi communication module (to ensure a secure data connection).
The current software and hardware version of your appliance.
Status of any previous reset to factory settings.

node.p: This initial registration prepares the Home Connect functions for use and is only required when you want to use the Home Connect functions for the first time.

hint.p: Please note that the Home Connect functions can only be utilised with the Home Connect app. Information on data protection can be retrieved in the Home Connect app.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Using detergents containing chlorine may result in harm to health.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Never use detergents containing chlorine.

instruction.p: Remove any coarse soiling in the interior with a damp cloth.
Add detergent to the detergent dispenser.
Select the programme with the highest temperature."Programmes",

node.creator: Hirn-ext, Stefan
node.title: Cleaning products
node.p: Only use suitable cleaning products to clean your appliance.

node.creator: Hirn-ext, Stefan
node.title: Tips on appliance care
node.p: Follow the tips on appliance care to make sure your appliance functions properly at all times.

proptype.p: Wipe the door seals, the front of the dishwasher and the control panel regularly using a damp cloth and washing-up liquid.

propvalue.p: This ensures the parts of the appliance will remain clean and hygienic.

proptype.p: If the appliance is not going to be used for a while, leave the door slightly ajar.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.p: Deposits, e.g. from remnants of food and limescale, can cause your appliance to malfunction. To avoid such faults and reduce odours, we recommend cleaning your appliance at regular intervals.
cleaning and careIndex 0PDC_UM - component identitymachine careMachine Care combined with machine care products and machine cleaners is the right programme for the care of your appliance.

hint.creator: Miller, Eva
hint.p: You can get our tested and approved Dishwasher Care and Machine Cleaner for Dishwashers online at https://www.bosch-home.com/store or from customer service.

node.p: cleaning and careIndex 0PDC_UM - component identitymachine careMachine Care is a programme which removes various deposits in one washing cycle. Cleaning takes place in two phases:

propdesc.p: Liquid machine care product or machine descaler in powder form.

addpropdesc.p: Appliance interior, e.g. bottle hung in the cutlery basket or powder in the interior.

propdesc.p: Machine cleaner

node.p: To ensure optimum cleaning performance, the programme doses the detergents independently of each another during the relevant cleaning phase. Correct placement of the detergents is necessary here.

cleaning and careIndex 0PDC_UM - component identitymachine careRun Machine Care without tableware if the indicator for Machine Care lights up on the control panel or if advised to do so by the display. The indicator will go out after you have run Machine Care. If your appliance does not have a reminder function, we recommend performing Machine Care every 2 months.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: cleaning and careIndex 0PDC_UM - component identitymachine careRunning Machine Care
node.p: cleaning and careIndex 0PDC_UM - component identitymachine careRun the Machine Care programme if the indicator for Machine Care lights up on the control panel or if advised to do so by the display.

sub-hint.p: Run the Machine Care programme without any tableware in the dishwasher.
Only use machine care products and machine cleaners specially designed for dishwashers.
Make sure that there are no aluminium parts, e.g. extractor hood grease filters or aluminium pans, in the interior of the appliance.
If you have not run Machine Care after 3 washing cycles, the indicator for Machine Care will go out automatically.
For optimum cleaning performance, ensure the correct placement of cleaners.
Follow the safety instructions given on the packagings of the machine care products and machine cleaners.
Activate the "Extra Clean Zone" function.

instruction.p: Remove any coarse soiling in the interior with a damp cloth.
Clean the filters.
Place the machine care product in the appliance interior.

instruction-info.p: Only use machine care products specially designed for dishwashers.

instruction.p: Pour the machine cleaner into the detergent dispenser until it is filled completely.

instruction-info.p: Do not place any additional machine cleaner in the appliance interior.

instruction.p: Press .
Press .

result.creator: Schmid, Bianca
result.p: Machine Care is run.

result.creator: Schmid, Bianca
result.p: Once the programme has ended, the indicator for Machine Care goes out.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Filter system
node.p: The filter system removes coarse soiling from the dishwashing cycle.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Cleaning filters
node.p: Soiling in the dishwashing water may block the filters.

instruction.p: After each wash check the filters for residue.
Turn the coarse filter anticlockwise and remove the filter system .

sub-instructions.sub-instruction: Check that no foreign objects fall into the sump.

instruction.p: Pull down the micro filter to remove.
Press the locking catches together and lift the coarse filter out .
Clean the filter elements under running water.

instruction-info.p: Carefully clean the rim of dirt between the coarse and the fine filter.

instruction.p: Re-assemble the filter system.

instruction-info.p: Make sure that the locking catches on the coarse filter click into position.

instruction.p: Insert the filter system into the appliance and turn the coarse filter clockwise.

instruction-info.p: Make sure that the arrow markings match up.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Cleaning spray arms
node.p: Limescale and soiling in the dishwashing water may block the nozzles and bearings on the spray arms. Clean the spray arms regularly.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Unscrew the upper spray arm and pull down to remove .
Pull up the lower spray arm to remove.
Check the outlet nozzles on the spray arms for blockages under running water and remove any foreign bodies.
Insert the lower spray arm.

result.p: The spray arm clicks into position.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Insert the upper spray arm and screw it firmly in place.

Restore the power supply.
Switch the appliance on.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Clean wastewater pump
node.p: Large remnants of food or foreign bodies can block the waste water pump. As soon as the rinsing water no longer drains properly, the waste water pump must be cleaned.

safety.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
safety.cause: Sharp and pointed objects or fragments of glass may block the waste water pump and cause injury.

safety-instructions.safety-instruction: Remove any foreign bodies carefully.

instruction.p: Disconnect the appliance from the power supply.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Remove the top and bottom basket.
Remove the filter system.
Scoop out any water.

instruction-info.p: Use a sponge if necessary.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Prise off the pump cover using a spoon and grip it by the crosspiece.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Lift the pump cover inwards at an angle and remove.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Remove any remnants of food and foreign bodies in the area of the impeller.

instruction.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
instruction.p: Insert the pump cover and press down .

result.p: The pump cover clicks into position.

instruction.p: Install the filter system.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Insert the top and bottom basket.

instruction.p: Disconnect the appliance from the power supply.
Turn off the water tap.
Detach the drainage connection.
Detach the drinking water connection.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Loosen any screws fastening the appliance to cabinet parts.

instruction.creator: Schmid, Bianca
instruction.p: Remove the base panel if fitted.
Pull the appliance out carefully, along with the hose behind it.

node.creator: Schweitzer, Christian
node.title: Protect appliance from frost
node.p: If there is a risk of frost where the appliance will be standing, e.g. in a holiday home, empty the appliance completely.

node.creator: Hirn-ext, Stefan
node.title: Transporting the appliance
node.p: To avoid damage to the appliance, empty it before transporting.

hint.p: Always transport the dishwasher upright to prevent residual water getting into the machine's controls and damaging the appliance.

instruction.p: Remove tableware from the appliance.
Secure loose parts.
Select the programme with the highest temperature. "Programmes",
To drain the appliance, terminate the programme after approx. 4 minutes. "Terminate programme",
Turn off the water tap.
To empty the residual water out of the appliance, detach the supply hose and let the water drain out.

node.p: In addition to warranty claims against the seller under the purchase agreement and in addition to our manufacturer's warranty, we offer compensation under the following conditions.

li.p: If our Aqua-Stop system is defective and causes water damage, we will make good the damage for private users. To ensure protection from water damage, the appliance must be connected to the power supply.
The liability guarantee is valid for the service life of the appliance.

A claim can only be made under the guarantee if the appliance has been correctly installed and connected with Aqua-Stop according to our instructions; this also includes correctly fitting the Aqua-Stop extension (genuine accessory). Our guarantee does not cover defective supply lines or fittings up to the Aqua-Stop connection on the tap.

If your appliance is fitted with Aqua-Stop, you can in principle leave your appliance unattended during operation and the tap turned on afterwards. The tap only needs to be turned off if you are away from home for a long period, e.g. on holiday for several weeks.

node.p: This product includes software components that are licensed by the copyright holders as free software or open source software.

The applicable licence information is stored on your home appliance. You can also access the applicable licence information via your Home Connect App: "Profile -> Legal information -> Licence Information". You can download the licence information on the brand product website (search for your appliance model on the product website and check additional documents). Alternatively, you can send a request to ossrequest@bshg.com or to BSH Hausgeräte GmbH GmbH, Carl-Wery-Str. 34, D-81739 München, Germany.
The source code will be made available to you on request.
To file a request, please email to ossrequest@bshg.com or send a written request to BSH Hausgeräte GmbH, Carl-Wery-Str. 34, D-81739 München, Germany.
Reference "OSSREQUEST"

The cost of performing your request will be charged to you. This offer is valid three years from the date of purchase or at least as long as we offer support and spare parts for the respective appliance.
